name: St. Fructuosus

locations.description: Bishop of Tarragona, martyred in Spain

summary: Fructuosus was the bishop of Tarragona in Spain who was martyred along with his deacons Augurius and Eulogius during the Valerian persecution in 259. According to the Acts of Fructuosus, he was arrested and burned at the stake. Before his death, he had a vision of his martyrdom and comforted his flock. He is one of the earliest documented martyrs in Spain and is venerated as the patron saint of Tarragona.
